meanings.definition: Excess stock of a particular item or items.
meanings.sent1: The store had overstocks of winter coats that they couldn't sell.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse was full of overstocks of old electronics.
meanings.sent3: The party had so many snacks, it looked like an overstocks buffet!
meanings.sent4: Her room was an overstocks warehouse of books, with stacks everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The overstocks of toys spilled out of the closet, creating a colorful mess.

meanings.definition: To accumulate too much stock of a particular item or items.
meanings.sent1: The company tends to overstocks on popular items, leading to storage issues.
meanings.sent2: She always overstocks on groceries and ends up throwing away a lot of food.
meanings.sent3: He overstocks on socks every winter, thinking he'll need them all.
meanings.sent4: The garden overstocks with flowers in spring, creating a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The shop overstocks on holiday decorations, filling every corner with festive items.
